attributes.action: (at least occasionally) ACT UPON a petition!
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: I have signed a number of petitions on this site about a wide range of social issues. At the closing date, a government response is sent to all signatories. EVERY RESPONSE I HAVE SEEN IGNORES THE PETITIONERS. Not once has the response been even as positive as "the prime minister is sympathetic and will investigate", let alone "the PM agrees with this petition and will take steps to include the issues raised in government policy policy"! Often a local authority or non-elected government body is quoted as being responsible - if it was possible to influence such bodies (who are often interpreting central government directives) the petitions would not have been created. It seems that e-petitions are just a way of letting Joe Public cool down under the collar at the keyboard, rather than phoning or writing to government departments. Come on, Mr Brown, show that you care by personally reading the petitions and supporting your voters in some of the matters which they really care about....

rejection.details: If you would like to comment on the petitioning system, please e-mail team@petitions.pm.gov.uk.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
